ISSUE.TITLE: 2 issues `iwp` in readme.md for Windows is not a valid command, URL returns 404
ISSUE.DESCRIPTION: The instructions say `iwp`, but that command doesn't exist by default in in Windows. I believe you want to use `iwr` which is the alias for Invoke-WebRequest. However, when using that command against the provided URL (http://get.nocodb.com/win-x64), you get a 404 error from GitHub **Steps To Reproduce** 1. Go to https://docs.nocodb.com/getting-started/installation 2. Copy `iwp http://get.nocodb.com/win-x64` 3. Paste into PowerShell terminal 4. See error: `iwp: The term 'iwp' is not recognized as a name of a cmdlet, function, script file, or executable program. Check the spelling of the name, or if a path was included, verify that the path is correct and try again.` 5. change `iwp` to `iwr` 6. get a new error that is essentially `404 - not found` 7. open URL (http://get.nocodb.com/win-x64) in browser 8. get 404 error from github **Expected Behavior** downloads the windows executable **Screenshots** If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Join our discord : https://discord.gg/5RgZmkW for realtime help.

COMMIT.MESSAGE: fix: cast boolean to integer when using rollup on bool type in pg (#3378)
fix: cast boolean to integer when using rollup on bool type in pg (#3378)
